subject: Technology
title: Blue Origin and Space Tourism
description: A 60-second lesson on Blue Origin and Space Tourism.

hook.text: In 2021, Jeff Bezos rode his own rocket to the edge of space and floated weightless for three minutes.

buildup.text: Blue Origin's New Shepard offers suborbital flights. Passengers experience weightlessness and see Earth's curve.

discovery.text: A seat costs hundreds of thousands of dollars. So far, space tourism is only for the ultra-wealthy.

twist.text: Critics asked why billionaires fly to space while Earth faces poverty and climate change.

climax.text: Supporters argue space tourism funds technology that will eventually benefit everyone, like early aviation did.

punchline.text: Space tourism is either the future of travel or the ultimate vanity project.

quiz.question: What type of spaceflight does Blue Origin currently offer?
options: Suborbital flights with a few minutes of weightlessness
